original: CLAESON, Per Richard, Fabrikör, Uddebo, f Uddebo, Tranemo, Älvsb l, 30/6 65 av fabr P A C o Augusta Sundström, gm Anna Bårström. Jönkp hal, stud textilind Tyskl. Anst Uddebo Trikåfabr AB 85. Grund Uddebo Möbeltyg Väfveri 95, driver nu dta tills m sonen disp Helge C. Ag Villa Furuhall, fabr.hus, arb-bost o skogsfastigh f väv. Led Kinds vägstyr 00—25, Vgl o N Hall hdlskamm, Tranemo kyrkoflm o sk.råd, styr.led Älvsb l lungsotssanat, Svenljunga sjukstuga; Uddebo AB (fd Udde-bo Trikåfabr AB), Falkenbergs jvks AB (vkst dir 25—30), Tullinge AB, Tostarps Träförädl AB, Svenljunga Omnibus AB. Styr.led ett flert frn. FI nöjes-, stud- o af f.re s Norge, Danm, Finl, östersjöprov, Tyskl, Österr, Schweiz, Ital, Engl. RNO, RVO. C :s farfar, riksdagsman i bondeståndet, drev handvävnad i Tostarp, Tranemo. Då C:s sonson nu är anst i Uddebo Möbeltyg har släkten drivit textilverksamhet i 5 generationer.
translated: CLAESON, Per Richard, Manufacturer, Uddebo, born in Uddebo, Tranemo, Älvsborg County, on June 30, 1865, to P A C and Augusta Sundström. Married to Anna Bårström. Completed primary education, studied textile industry in Germany. Employed at Uddebo Trikåfabr AB since 1885. Founded Uddebo Möbeltyg Väfveri in 1895 and currently runs the business together with his son, Helge C. Resides at Villa Furuhall, a factory house, and owns a residential and forest property for weaving purposes. Served as a member of the Kinds road board from 1900 to 1925, member of the Vgl and N Hall trade chambers, Tranemo church film and school board, and governing board of Älvsborg County tuberculosis sanatorium and Svenljunga hospital. Also served on the boards of Uddebo AB (formerly Uddebo Trikåfabr AB), Falkenbergs jvks AB (as a managing director from 1925 to 1930), Tullinge AB, Tostarps Träförädl AB, and Svenljunga Omnibus AB. Board member of several entertainment, educational, and professional organizations in Norway, Denmark, Finland, Baltic countries, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, and England. Awarded RNO (Royal Order of the Northern Star) and RVO (Royal Order of Vasa). C's paternal grandfather, a member of the peasant estate in the parliament, engaged in hand weaving in Tostarp, Tranemo. With C's grandson currently employed at Uddebo Möbeltyg, the family has been involved in the textile industry for five generations.
